website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive helmet with an eagle logo and a nice viewing area size.
pros: Designed for safe arc welding and cutting with a plasma arc
Will run from solar power in case the battery power fails
Viewing area measures 3.5 inches by 1.375 inches
Meets a variety of standards, including GS, ANSI and CE
Works quickly to darken the viewing area
cons: Not necessarily designed for heavy-duty use

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HOOD FOR THE MONEY

customer_reviews.title: Plastic nuts/bolts stripped after first use.
customer_reviews.text: After the first use the plastics nuts/bolts that hold the visor in the up position were stripped and will no longer hold the visor up, which makes it really hard to view your work before you start welding. This makes me hate the dam thing. I did not tighten them excessively at all. Just enough to hold the visor up, adjusting them just to the point that the visor would not fall down easily. Tightening them this lightly caused them to strip. If it wasn't for that I'd give it five starts because otherwise it works well, but it deserves one star for failing to perform it's designed purpose.
customer_reviews.author: glos

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 8 months

Then the knob holding it all together broke. i suppose nearly all cheap goods are made of low-grade plastic. Tried to contact them but purchased it too long ago. I drilled it out and used a bolt, which looks super dorky, but it it works. I wish it went a little darker for flux core welding. my eyes get slight light burn.

It just seems to stop working with the slightest bump or knock.
